abstract: Britain's National Health Service, universal health system that has achieved revered status in country since its creation in 1948, has emerged as central factor in coming national elections; both Conservative and Labour party have presented themselves as protectors of system, pledging to allocate large new sums to shore up its strained resources.
lead_paragraph: Despite its many shortcomings, Britain’s National Health Service is held in such high esteem that competing claims to be its protector could help decide national elections next month.

headline.main: Britain’s National Health Service, Creaking but Revered, Looms Over Elections
headline.print_headline: Britain’s National Health Service, Creaking but Revered, Looms Over Elections

snippet: Despite its many shortcomings, Britain’s National Health Service is held in such high esteem that competing claims to be its protector could help decide national elections next month.
